Toggle Menu

salt.states.rabbitmq_policy

Manage RabbitMQ Policies

maintainer

Benn Eichhorn <benn@getlocalmeasure.com>

maturity

new

platform

all

Example:

rabbit_policy:
    rabbitmq_policy.present:
        - name: HA
        - pattern: '.*'
        - definition: '{"ha-mode": "all"}'

absent

Syntax

salt.states.rabbitmq_policy.absent(
								name,
								vhost='/',
								runas=None
								)

Ensure the named policy is absent

Reference: http://www.rabbitmq.com/ha.html

Arguments

Name Description
name

The name of the policy to remove
runas

Name of the user to run the command as

present

Syntax

salt.states.rabbitmq_policy.present(
								name,
								pattern,
								definition,
								priority=0,
								vhost='/',
								runas=None
								)

Ensure the RabbitMQ policy exists.

Reference: http://www.rabbitmq.com/ha.html

Arguments

Name Description
name

Policy name
pattern

A regex of queues to apply the policy to
definition

A json dict describing the policy
priority

Priority (defaults to 0)
vhost

Virtual host to apply to (defaults to '/')
runas

Name of the user to run the command as
